channel.title: Posts on Hugo-smorg
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Hugo-smorg

item.title: Syntax Highlighting
item.author: thisemaildoesnotexist@www.example.com (Your Name)
item.description: Code examples in different languagues to demonstrate syntax highlighting with the current hugo-smorg theme. Inline code looks like this->var and expand($flurb, $times).

item.title: Creating a New Theme
item.author: thisemaildoesnotexist@www.example.com (Your Name)
item.description: Introduction This tutorial will show you how to create a simple theme in Hugo. I assume that you are familiar with HTML, the bash command line, and that you are comfortable using Markdown to format content.

item.title: (Hu)go Template Primer
item.author: thisemaildoesnotexist@www.example.com (Your Name)
item.description: Hugo uses the excellent go html/template library for its template engine. It is an extremely lightweight engine that provides a very small amount of logic.

item.title: Getting Started with Hugo
item.author: thisemaildoesnotexist@www.example.com (Your Name)
item.description: Step 1. Install Hugo Goto hugo releases and download the appropriate version for your os and architecture. Save it somewhere specific as we will be using it in the next step.

item.title: Migrate to Hugo from Jekyll
item.author: thisemaildoesnotexist@www.example.com (Your Name)
item.description: Move static content to static Jekyll has a rule that any directory not starting with _ will be copied as-is to the _site output.
